meanings.sent1: The trisubstituted molecule had three different parts attached.
meanings.sent2: The chemist studied the trisubstituted compound under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The trisubstituted puzzle was missing three crucial pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her trisubstituted outfit combined a hat, scarf, and gloves.
meanings.sent5: The trisubstituted flower had petals, leaves, and a stem.

meanings.definition: To replace or exchange three parts or elements with others.
meanings.sent1: She trisubstituted the ingredients in the recipe to create a new flavor.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic trisubstituted the damaged parts of the engine with new ones.
meanings.sent3: He trisubstituted the characters in the story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The artist trisubstituted the colors in the painting for a brighter effect.
meanings.sent5: They trisubstituted the old furniture in the room with modern pieces.
